squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.locks

Interface IRoomLayout

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RoomLayout

    public interface IRoomLayout
    Represents the spatial layout of a lock-and-key puzzle and contains all Symbols, Rooms and Edges within the puzzle.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Room room)
      Adds a new room to the dungeon, overwriting any rooms already in it that have the same coordinates.
      Room findBoss() 
      Room findGoal() 
      Room findStart() 
      Room findSwitch() 
      Room get(int id) 
      Rect2I getExtentBounds()
      Gets the Rect2I that encloses every room within the dungeon.
      SortedSet<Room> getRooms() 
      void link(Room room1, Room room2)
      Adds a two-way unconditional edge between the given rooms.
      void link(Room room1, Room room2, int cond)
      Adds a two-way conditional edge between the given rooms.
      void linkOneWay(Room room1, Room room2)
      Adds a one-way unconditional edge between the given rooms.
      void linkOneWay(Room room1, Room room2, int cond)
      Adds a one-way conditional edge between the given rooms.
      int roomCount() 
      boolean roomsAreLinked(Room room1, Room room2)
      Tests whether two rooms are linked.

    • Method Detail

      • getRooms

        SortedSet<Room> getRooms()
        Returns:
        the rooms within the dungeon

      • roomCount

        int roomCount()
        Returns:
        the number of rooms in the dungeon

      • get

        Room get(int id)
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the room
        Returns:
        the room with the given id

      • add

        void add(Room room)
        Adds a new room to the dungeon, overwriting any rooms already in it that have the same coordinates.
        Parameters:
        room - the room to add

      • linkOneWay

        void linkOneWay(Room room1,
                Room room2)
        Adds a one-way unconditional edge between the given rooms. A one-way edge may be used to travel from room1 to room2, but not room2 to room1.
        Parameters:
        room1 - the first room to link
        room2 - the second room to link

      • link

        void link(Room room1,
          Room room2)
        Adds a two-way unconditional edge between the given rooms. A two-way edge may be used to travel from each room to the other.
        Parameters:
        room1 - the first room to link
        room2 - the second room to link

      • linkOneWay

        void linkOneWay(Room room1,
                Room room2,
                int cond)
        Adds a one-way conditional edge between the given rooms. A one-way edge may be used to travel from room1 to room2, but not room2 to room1.
        Parameters:
        room1 - the first room to link
        room2 - the second room to link
        cond - the condition on the edge

      • link

        void link(Room room1,
          Room room2,
          int cond)
        Adds a two-way conditional edge between the given rooms. A two-way edge may be used to travel from each room to the other.
        Parameters:
        room1 - the first room to link
        room2 - the second room to link
        cond - the condition on the edge

      • roomsAreLinked

        boolean roomsAreLinked(Room room1,
                       Room room2)
        Tests whether two rooms are linked. Two rooms are linked if there are any edges (in any direction) between them.
        Returns:
        true if the rooms are linked, false otherwise

      • findStart

        Room findStart()
        Returns:
        the room containing the START symbol

      • findBoss

        Room findBoss()
        Returns:
        the room containing the BOSS symbol

      • findGoal

        Room findGoal()
        Returns:
        the room containing the GOAL symbol

      • findSwitch

        Room findSwitch()
        Returns:
        the room containing the SWITCH symbol

      • getExtentBounds

        Rect2I getExtentBounds()
        Gets the Rect2I that encloses every room within the dungeon.

        The Bounds object has the X coordinate of the West-most room, the Y coordinate of the North-most room, the 'right' coordinate of the East-most room, and the 'bottom' coordinate of the South-most room.

        Returns:
        the rectangle enclosing every room within the dungeon
